page.title: 02ECOLOGY,GEOLOGY
page.content: The whole area lies within the outcrop of sedimentary rocks - sandstones and grits - of Old Red Sandstone (Devonian) age. These rocks dip southwards into the syncline of the South Wales Coalfield thereby giving rise to the north-facing escarpment which, to the south of this area, is represented by Fan Gihirych and the Carmarthen Fans. The high peaks show abundant evidence of glacial erosion and cirque development along the escarpment. These lower slopes were predominantly areas of glacial deposition where morainic material from the small cirque glaciers was deposited.
